intro: Gynoxys asterotricha, commonly known as the star-haired gynoxys, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, star-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
